title: Chef De Piece, 1810–13
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: block-printed on plain weave with separate blocks for red, blue and yellow.
inscribed: Partial stamped impression at one end: "J-D.Bridel et Fils" in bob. Slight indication of a printer's identificationb mark in yellow.
provenance: Formerly in the collection of Elinor Merrell where it was No. 10 on her list of chefs de piece.
dimensions:
Warp: (maximum) 83 cm (32 3/4 in.). Weft: (5 pieces sewn together) 64 cm (25 1/4 in.)
Pattern: Height of repeat: 30 cm (12 in.). Width not present in these fragments.
description: Floral sprigs and floral stripes on a red background. Faded yellow and blue present.

tombstone.epitaph:
Chef De Piece, 1810–13.
1810–13. Medium: cotton
Technique: block-printed on plain weave with separate blocks for red, blue and yellow.. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-30.
